Quotes: Tact is the ability to describe others as they see themselves.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: Some day I shall be President.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: Every one desires to live long, but no one would be old.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: I don't know who my grandfather was;I am much more concerned to know what his grandson will be.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: You cannot escape the responsibility of tomorrow by evading it today.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: A perfection of means, and confusion of aims, seems to be our main problem.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: Few people are capable of expressing with equanimity opinions which differ from the prejudices of their social environment. Most people are even incapable of forming such opinions.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: There could be no fairer destiny for any physical theory than that it should point the way to a more comprehensive theory in which it lives on as a limiting case.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: Change in all things is sweet.
Author: Aristotel

Quotes: Bring your desires down to your present means. Increase them only when your increased means permit.
Author: Aristotel

Quotes: He does not possess wealth;it possesses him.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: Hunger is the best pickle.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: The first mistake in public business is the going into it.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: If you desire many things, many things will seem few.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: It is much easier to suppress a first desire than to satisfy those that follow.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: Little things console us because little things afflict us.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: What is thine is mine, and all mine is thine.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: How many cares one loses when one decides not to be something but to be someone.
Author: Coco Chanel

Quotes: If I am walking with two other men, each of them will serve as my teacher. I will pick out the good points of the one and imitate them, and the bad points of the other and correct them in myself.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: I describe myself as a simple Buddhist monk. No more, no less.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quotes: By desiring little, a poor man makes himself rich.
Author: Democritus

Quotes: A distant enemy is always preferable to one at the gate.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: Innocence does not find near so much protection as guilt.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: We are very far from always knowing our own wishes.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: We get so much in the habit of wearing disguises before others that we finally appear disguised before ourselves.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: He that humbleth himself wishes to be exalted.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: To use the same words is not a sufficient guarantee of understanding;one must use the same words for the same genus of inward experience;ultimately one must have one's experiences in common.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: People who say it cannot be done should not interrupt those who are doing it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: I never resist temptation, because I have found that things that are bad for me do not tempt me.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: He was like a cock who thought the sun had risen to hear him crow.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: When we get to wishing a great deal for ourselves, whatever we get soon turns into mere limitation and exclusion.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: If you've heard this story before, don't stop me, because I'd like to hear it again.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: There is no man living that can not do more than he thinks he can.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: What is a child, monsieur, but the image of two beings, the fruit of two sentiments spontaneously blended?
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quotes: The only objects of practical reason are therefore those of good and evil. For by the former is meant an object necessarily desired according to a principle of reason;by the latter one necessarily shunned, also according to a principle of reason.
Author: Immanuel Kant

Quotes: We do not know what is really good or bad fortune.
Author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

Quotes: The postman wants an autograph. The cab driver wants a picture. The waitress wants a handshake. Everyone wants a piece of you.
Author: John Lennon

Quotes: I would rather have a nod from an American, than a snuff-box from an emperor.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: Giving up smoking is the easiest thing in the world. I know because I've done it thousands of times.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: As an example to others, and not that I care for moderation myself, it has always been my rule never to smoke when asleep, and never to refrain from smoking when awake.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: There is a charm about the forbidden that makes it unspeakably desirable.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: I am the only person in the world I should like to know thoroughly.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Ambition is the germ from which all growth of nobleness proceeds.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: As long as war is regarded as wicked, it will always have its fascination. When it is looked upon as vulgar, it will cease to be popular.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Anybody can be good in the country. There are no temptations there.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Our ambition should be to rule ourselves, the true kingdom for each one of us;and true progress is to know more, and be more, and to do more.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: I'd like to live as a poor man with lots of money.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: When you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quotes: I shall assume that your silence gives consent.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Faith is the bird that feels the light when the dawn is still dark.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quotes: I have become my own version of an optimist. If I can't make it through one door, I'll go through another door - or I'll make a door. Something terrific will come no matter how dark the present.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quotes: You can't cross the sea merely by standing and staring at the water.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quotes: My goal is to entertain myself and others.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quotes: You can't try to do things;you simply must do them.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quotes: We never reflect how pleasant it is to ask for nothing.
Author: Seneca

Quotes: Commerce with all nations, alliance with none, should be our motto.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quotes: An enemy generally says and believes what he wishes.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quotes: I have seen enough of one war never to wish to see another.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quotes: It is not enough to conquer;one must learn to seduce.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: I should like to lie at your feet and die in your arms.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: Our peace shall stand as firm as rocky mountains.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: I may neither choose who I would, nor refuse who I dislike;so is the will of a living daughter curbed by the will of a dead father.
Author: William Shakespeare
